title: Phil Baines
content:
Back in 1997 I went to London and checked out the St. Martin's Academy Of Art College. I picked up a gorgeous brochure (which I later lent to one of those people that do not return books).   
The brochure had text set in custom fonts by Phil Baines as well as Barnbrook's Manson ( later renamed Mason ), and also some student typefaces. Phils work was very innovative and I was hoping someone knew where to get his faces or at least view them. As I recall the "A" and "e" looked something like this. The only font I have seen anywhere is "Can you" from Fontshop / Fuse.   
   
  ![baines.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140808232252im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/30/847.jpg)
author: designalchemy

comments.content:
Ole,   
   
Not sure where to find his typeface work,   
but he recently contributed to an article   
in Eye magazine:   
   
 [http://www.eyemagazine.com/feature.php?id=4&fid=11](http://web.archive.org/web/20140808232252/http:/www.eyemagazine.com/feature.php?id=4&fid=11)   
   
Stephen
